result.execSummary:
The defendant Kareem C Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:35 P.M., Defendant Kareem C Washington in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentences defendant to: 10 months jail w/Huber, consecutive, 98 days sentence credit, civil judgment to be entered on any unpaid court obligations, 1:42 P.M.

Waiver of Right to Attorney and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant.

Defendant, Kareem C Washington, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Atty filed, Court accepts Waiver, Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court withholds sentence, probation 18 months, $268.00 costs, $250.00 DNA Surcharge, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, AODA and comply, Defendant may apply for expunction after 18 months if no further law violations, fine paid in full, probation successfully completed, and successful completion of any counseling,
Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.

Defendant, Kareem C Washington, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
